channel.title: Demo on REDtalks.live
channel.description: Recent content in Demo on REDtalks.live

item.title: REDtalks.live #041 - Grafana Dashboard update for SSL stats
item.description: Watch this episode to see how you can view F5 BIG-IP SSL statistics in the latest Grafana Dashboard for the BigStats telemetry exporter. Well, I know I already posted the end of year wrap-up episode (REDtalks.

item.title: REDtalks.live #039 - Me at Github Universe
item.description: Last week Github Universe happened. You missed it? I’m sorry. Don’t let it happen again! Github Universe is awesome. Some things that stood out for me: 1) No Badge Scanning It took me no more than 30 seconds to get through registration and collect my badge, a process that brings with it the reminder of how many times I’m going to be scanned onto follow-up email and call lists for things I’m really not interested in.

item.title: REDtalks.live #035 – How to get started
item.description: In this episode I’m joined by F5 Consultant, Vinnie Mazza, to hear his experiences with getting started on his programmability and automation journey. Vinnie shares with us how a project outside of work inspired him to learn new skills that, coincidentally, are directly transferable to the workplace.

item.title: REDtalks.live #034 - GitHub Integration v0.2 released
item.description: Greetings automators!!! I am delighted to be sharing with you the release of the GitHub Webhook Server for BIG-IP v0.2. w00t! This release was a major re-write that touched almost every line of code.

item.title: REDtalks.live #032 - Stats & Dashboards
item.description: We appear to be leaving the era of polling devices for stats and then processing them into something meaningful. This is what happy customers are telling me! So, how should we be operating in the future?

item.title: REDtalks.live #031 - Network Configuration as Code - Part 3
item.description: Install, Setup and Troubleshooting Other episodes in this series: Episode 1 – Intro to Network Infrastructure as Code Episode 2 – Access Control and Change Rollback Episode 3 – Install, Setup and Troubleshooting Welcome to part 3 in this Network Infrastructure as Code series.

item.title: REDtalks.live #030 - Network Configuration as Code - Part 2
item.description: Role-based Access Control and Change Rollback Other episodes in this series: Episode 1 - Intro to Network Infrastructure as Code Episode 2 - Access Control and Change Rollback Episode 3 - Install, Setup, and Troubleshooting Welcome to part 2 in this Network Infrastructure as Code series.

item.title: REDtalks.live #029 - Network Configuration as Code - Part 1
item.description: Introduction to Network Infrastructure as Code Other episodes in this series: Episode 1 - Intro to Network Infrastructure as Code Episode 2 - Access Control and Change Rollback Episode 3 - Install, Setup and Troubleshooting Greetings viewers and welcome to a short series of technical demonstrations on Infrastructure as Code.

item.title: REDtalks.live #025: MiniKube for Dev's
item.description: Another great episode from our F5 Incubator friends, ApsenMesh.io. In this episode I’m joined by Sr Architect, Andrew Jenkins, who explains how, in mere seconds, he spins up Kubernetes clusters on his laptop in a docker container.

item.title: REDtalks #017 - Orchestration 2.0 (w/ a side of bacon)
item.description: Greeting automators and welcome to edisode #17 of REDtalks. Today’s guest is Tyler Hatton who is from WWTs own internal IT Operations team. Tyler is the F5 BIG-IP Subject Matter Expert for WWT and is hell-bent on replacing the mundane with declarative interfaces and orchestration systems.

item.title: REDtalks #016 - Andy & Tom on Metrics Driven Automation
item.description: In episode #16 we are joined by Andreas (Andy) Grabner, of Dynatrace, and Tom McGonagle, of F5 Networks. Watch this episode to hear about Metrics Driven Automation, or Informed Automation, and how this takes the feat out of fully integrated deployment pipelines.

item.title: REDtalks #013 – Mark & Joe on Cisco CloudCenter (formerly CliQr)
item.description: Mark Wall and Joe Weber of WWT join me in lucky episode #13 to discuss automation with Cisco CloudCenter (the artist formerly known as CliQr). As many already know, in 2016 Cisco bought CliQr, which has since been renamed Cisco CloudCenter.

item.title: REDtalks #011 - Anthony on Automation with Excel
item.description: UPDATED: Feb 9th, 2017 The beauty of REST is that you can call upon it from just about anywhere. REST doesn’t care which OS you are using or whether you prefer a command-line tool over a GUI, or vice versa.

item.title: REDtalks #010 - Getting started with Ansible Tower and F5 iApps
item.description: There’s a lot of great content out there on Ansible playbooks. However, not so much on how to get started. So, this article is to share how I got from “never seen Ansible” to “automating L4 - L7 Service deployments”.

item.title: REDtalks #009 - Joel on lab portability with Vagrant
item.description: Joel King of WWT is back with us again and in this episode we cover the importance of test/eval environment portability. These days, few have the luxury of static, consistent environments.

item.title: REDtalks #006 - Michael O'Leary on self-service with vRO/vRA
item.description: We were lucky enough to get Michael O’Leary back so soon for another episode, and, this time, a self-service demonstration. In “REDtalks #04 – Michael O’Leary on orchestration with VMware vRO” we discussed the benefits of automating infrastructure and Michael shared some great tips on how to get started.
